author: Staff Reporter
text:
Owing to increasing patronage, the Vellore Corporation has spruced up the children’s park at Otteri.

Officials of the Corporation said the park received a facelift after there was overgrowth of bushes and shrubs, and a few play equipment required repair and replacement.

The Corporation’s council, during its meeting in December, had given its nod to take up renovation works at a cost of Rs. 11 lakh. Residents said the park received good crowd during weekends. For a city that has limited getaways, this spruced up facility could come as a breathing space.

“The park was inaugurated by the Chief Minister in 2014. We have given a fresh coat of paint for the park. The works have been completed,” said G. Shanmugam, councillor of ward number 44. He added that the flow of crowd to the park increased after the water level in Otteri Tank swelled following the November rains. Security personnel have also been engaged at the park, and an entry fee of Rs. Five is being collected.
title: Children’s park at Otteri gets a facelift
